Bag O' Links - 4/5/2010

Links

  • The ruby reflector – another Ruby/Rails news aggregator, looks nice really.
  • Using Git + Dropbox – or, you can simply start your project in a Dropbox folder.
  • Schema design with MongoDB – slides.
  • MongoMachine – another MongoDB hosting service.
  • The case for Git Rebase – Rebase vs. Merge.
  • 2 Weeks with Cassandra – James on Cassandra.
  • Easier admin panels for Rails – nice black magic with Sinatra.
  • Behind the scenes of an online market place – implementation and infrastructure tips.
  • Devver’s Terms of service and Privacy Policy are open sourced, sad to see those guys go again.

Treasures

  • A quick example of Facebook’s REST+OAuth in Ruby – simple really.
  • Guilded -a framework for building web based components centered around current web standards and best practices. i wonder how it will turn out.
  • CloudyScripts – Scripts to facilitate programming for infrastructure clouds.
  • Ogit – Facebook Open Graph terminal.
  • Barista – Transparent coffeescript support for rails 3.
  • CSS3 for IE – Another attempt.
  • SuperModel – In-Memory models for Rails.
  • a collection of MongoDB utilities – is right here.
  • TwiBot – a Twitter bot in Ruby.
  • jStackMenu – a really nice stack menu implementation in jQuery.
  • Sonia – a Team/Projects monitor panel.
  • Fedena – open source, school/campus management ERP.
  • Cinch – IRC framework in ruby.
